results.title: Dorothy Hewett
results.brief_description: Australia’s best known female playwright, Dorothy Hewett, looks back on her childhood influences and the place of music, poetry and art in her work.

results.title: Dorothy Heathcote talks to teachers. Pt. 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Northwestern University, Bernice Gregorio and Dana H. Hodgdon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
Drama in the classroom continues with the discussion of techniques developed by Mrs. Heathcote. “Questioning”, “storyline”, “universals” and “brother hoods” are examined. Drama is related to developing language and social skills, while teaching subject material. Mrs. Heathcote’s educative process is based on total involvement that ultimately modifies behaviour.

results.title: Dorothy Heathcote talks to teachers. Pt. 1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Northwestern University, Bernice Gregorio and Dana H. Hodgdon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
In a teachers’ workshop, Dorothy Heathcote, England’s outstanding drama educator, explores the theory of improvised drama as a teaching tool for all classroom teachers. She analyses her unique process, explaining and illustrating techniques for developing materials, the use of dramatic elements and the segmenting of ideas to achieve dramatic focus.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Northwestern University, Bernice Gregorio and Dana H. Hodgdon

results.title: Dorothy Green
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Videos on Australian Writers: archival writers series II”.
Poet, journalist, author and academic, Dorothy Green speaks of her early childhood in England. She recalls the atmosphere of Sydney University in the 1930’s and her early success as a poet which led to a career in journalism. Green worked as a teacher and university lecturer in 1972, a grant enabled her to devote herself to writing. Green reads and discusses several of her poems and speaks of her spiritual beliefs and attitudes towards death. Interviewed by James Murdoch.

results.title: Dorothea Lange. Pt. 2: the closer for me
results.creator_credit: KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.), Philip Greene, Robert Katz and Richard Moore
results.brief_description: Concentrates on Dorothea Lange’s renowned work on the Farm Security Administration (FSA) project during the depression. Also looks at her photographs during the war and a project on urban sprawl in California which occupied her during the last years of her life. Lange reviews these images and talks about her belief that photography is a universal language. Photographed by Phillip Greene.

results.title: Dorothea Lange. Pt. 1: under the trees
results.creator_credit: KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.), Philip Greene, Robert Katz and Richard Moore
results.brief_description: An intimate view of Dorothea Lange filmed during the last year of her life as she worked on a retrospective exhibition for the Museum of Modern Art. As she reviews her work, she is self critical and revealing, explaining how she felt when she took certain pictures. Most famous for her rural images during the depression, particularly the photograph ‘Migrant Mother’. Photographed by Phillip Greene.

results.title: Dorothea [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Anna Grieve and Wendy Chandler
results.brief_description: A young Greek woman, Dorothea, escapes her family’s resistance to adopting new ways and an arranged marriage by becoming involved in a theatre group and falling for the lead performer. Cast includes Helen Dullas, William Dye and Saavas Panas.
results.description: A young Greek woman, Dorothea, escapes her family’s resistance to adopting new ways and an arranged marriage by becoming involved in a theatre group and falling for the lead performer. Cast includes Helen Dullas, William Dye and Saavas Panas.

results.title: Doris Lessing
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and John Archer
results.brief_description: Well known writer Doris Lessing is interviewed about her life in Africa and the books she has written including “The grass is singing”, “The golden notebook”, “Briefing for a descent into hell”, and “Marriage between Zones 3,4 and 5”.
results.description: Well known writer Doris Lessing is interviewed about her life in Africa and the books she has written including “The grass is singing”, “The golden notebook”, “Briefing for a descent into hell”, and “Marriage between Zones 3,4 and 5”.
